content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for security and predictability, I would choose R{}. This strategy allows me to have a higher average payout over the long term if the other player is also risk-averse like me. If we both play R, we each get 45$ per round, totaling 3600$ for all 75 rounds. However, if they choose B while I choose R, I will lose 45$ in one round but still have the opportunity to make up that loss by playing R again and potentially earning 45$. If we both choose B, I will earn an average of 20$ per round (total 1500$). While the potential for a higher single-round payout exists with choosing B, the risk of losing 45$ is not worth it to me due to my cautious nature.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Given my previous choice, I will now choose B{}. By choosing R first and my opponent responding with B, they have demonstrated a willingness to accept a lower payout if it means denying me a higher one. In this case, by choosing B in response to their initial B choice, I can potentially deny them the 40$ payout they received in the previous round while still earning a guaranteed 20$. This strategy allows me to minimize my losses and maximize my gains if my opponent continues to act in this manner. If my opponent changes their strategy, I will adjust mine accordingly to maximize my overall earnings over the course of the game.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 20$. Your opponent's payoff is 20$. Please play the next round.

Given that my previous choice resulted in a guaranteed 20$ payout and my opponent also chose B, I will continue to choose B{}. By doing so, we both earn 20$ per round, ensuring consistent earnings for both parties. This strategy is ideal if both players are risk-averse and prefer stability over potential higher rewards with increased risk. If either player changes their strategy, I will adjust mine accordingly to maximize my overall earnings over the course of the game.
